protein.general_function: Involved in G-protein coupled receptor protein signaling pathway
protein.specific_function: Low affinity receptor for N-formyl-methionyl peptides, which are powerful neutrophils chemotactic factors. Binding of FMLP to the receptor causes activation of neutrophils. This response is mediated via a G-protein that activates a phosphatidylinositol-calcium second messenger system. The activation of LXA4R could result in an anti-inflammatory outcome counteracting the actions of proinflammatory signals such as LTB4 (leukotriene B4)

go_class.description: cell surface receptor linked signaling pathway
g-protein coupled receptor protein signaling pathway
